title: I tried Windows 11!
description: Play World of Tanks for free:  New players will receive the Excelsior tank, 250,000 credits, and 7 days premium access by using code TANKMANIA. Thanks to Wargaming for sponsoring this video!   LISTEN TO THE TECH NEWS:  GET MERCH:  SUPPORT US ON FLOATPLANE:    LTX EXPO:      Timestamps: 0:00 The Host (2021) 0:13 Windows 11 leaked build 1:38 Google updates lotsa stuff 2:38 end of E3 highlights 3:53 World of Tanks 4:42 QUICK BITS 4:46 RX 6600M, 6900 Liquid Cooled 5:15 OnePlus "merging" with Oppo 5:43 Oculus Quest 1 gets Air Link, ads 6:07 Starlink dishes overheat 6:27 Sir Tim Berners-Lee selling NFTs for charity  NEWS SOURCES  TURN IT UP TO AAAAH GAMING on Windows 11:        sound    THE WINDS OF GOOGLE Is it an upgrade if it goes away? Gmail, Chat, Docs integration rolls out for everyone     Google rolls out E2E encryption in Messages under certain conditions    Google retail store   EVERYBODY EXCITED EVERYWHERE  Zelda, sort of   Metroid Dread   Halo Infinite multiplayer   Homeworld Mobile   Steam Next Fest    QUICK BITS  REMEMBER GPUS? RX 6600M benchmarks   RX 6900 XT Liquid Cooled    BRANDS. GOTTA LOVE EM OnePlus merges with Oppo      THE BEST AND THE WORST Oculus Quest 1 will get wireless PC VR streaming too  also ads    STARFRIED Starlink dishes can overheat      WHAT, THIS OLD THING? Sir Tim Berners-Lee auctioning Web source code as NFT      ---------------------------------------------------   AFFILIATES & REFERRALS --------------------------------------------------- Affiliates, Sponsors & Referrals:  Private Internet Access VPN:  MK Keyboards:  Nerd or Die Stream Overlays:  Official Game Store:  Amazon Prime:  Audible Free Trial:  Our Gear on Amazon:    FOLLOW US ELSEWHERE ---------------------------------------------------   Twitter:  Instagram:  Facebook:     FOLLOW OUR OTHER CHANNELS ---------------------------------------------------   Linus Tech Tips:  Mac Address:  Techquickie:  ShortCircuit:  LMG Clips:  Channel Super Fun:  Carpool Critics:

It seems so surreal when rumors about Windows 11 started popping up, but then Microsoft teased it pretty blatantly with that 11-minute-long slo-fi startup sound video last week, and then yesterday a preview build of Windows 11 leaked, confirming that it's a thing and that conspiracy theorists worldwide could celebrate! They're finally vindicated, Riley! - [Riley] I'll see you at the conference! So that's it, guys, whatever pseudo-historic event that you've been chatting about on that dark web forum, it's real. A bunch of internet people have gotten the new OS running in a virtual machine and it most prominently features a new Start menu design with centered task bar icons straight out of the canceled Windows 10X, except that you can also move those things to the left side and go back to the old Start menu. Also, the windows themselves have rounded corners, there's new icons in File Explorer, and a new Widgets panel on the left side which looks like the new panel that they just added on Windows... Like the new startup one, which is nice. - [Riley] Have you heard it? - I haven't actually heard it yet. - [Riley] Oh, it's such a banger. - Great. It's fun though, right? - [Riley] It's fun. - Ah, 11! What a fun number! Speaking of nebulous upgrades, Google is rolling out that fancy new Workspace UI for Gmail, Drive, and Chat to everyone, not just their enterprise customers. The changes make each of these products more like one integrated Google thing, allowing you to split screen Gmail and Docs in one tab, for example. Google... That's unnatural. Google's also adding end-to-end encryption to the Android Messages app and it'll work perfectly as long as both senders are using the Messages app, have enabled Rich Communication Service, or RCS, in the settings, and are in a one-to-one chat rather than a group conversation. - [Riley] That's everything. - It's no iMessage but it's something that may go away if Google decides not enough people have thanked them for adding it. Google is also launching their first physical retail store in New York City, which is cool for new Yorkers but also just making more work for themselves when they decide to add that to the graveyard. - [Riley] You have to get whole crane and everything. - And if you're a capital G gamer, you probably noticed that E3 has been going on over the past week and there's no way I'm gonna be able to cover every single thing that every gamer cares about.
